org.tagaprice.server
Class DBConnection

java.lang.Object
  org.tagaprice.server.DBConnection

public class DBConnection
extends java.lang.Object

Wrapper around a database connection. This class cares about setting up the connection using the jdbc.properties file and pools it, once created. TODO refactor/check transaction-management in this class TODO move this class out of src - not needed here, move to where DatabaseManager (only using class) is

DBConnection

public DBConnection()
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.io.FileNotFoundException
Constructor that tries to get the DB configuration from the file jdbc.properties in the classpath.

Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if jdbc_testing.properties isn't found
java.io.IOException - if any other property-file related problem occurs

disconnect

public void disconnect()
                throws java.sql.SQLException
Disconnect from the database (close the connection).

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
Gets a preconfigured connection to the database.

Returns:
the cached connection, or a new connection from the pool
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

prepareStatement

public java.sql.PreparedStatement prepareStatement(java.lang.String stmt)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
Gets a PreparedStatement from the preconfigured connection.

Parameters:
stmt - the statement to prepare
Returns:
a PreparedStatement generated from the preconfigured connection.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs, this method is called on a closed connection or the given parameters are not ResultSet constants indicating type and concurrency

begin

public void begin()
           throws java.sql.SQLException
TODO refactor this, this may be buggy...(see forceRollback(), commit() and rollback()) Starts a new transaction on the database if not already antoher transaction is active. If one or more "inner" transactions are already in progress, this call will start an "inner transaction"; an actual commit will only occur, when all "inner transaction" are commited. (see DBConnection

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs

commit

public void commit()
            throws java.sql.SQLException
TODO refactor this, this may be buggy...(see forceRollback(), rollback() and begin()) Commits a previously started transaction. If one or more "inner" transactions are already in progress, this will commit the "innermost" transaction.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs of the transaction cannot be commited (e.g. ROLLBACK)

rollback

public void rollback()
              throws java.sql.SQLException
TODO refactor this, this IS be buggy... (see forceRollback(), commit() and begin()) Calls a ROLLBACK on the database.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs, or no transaction is in progress
